cells.data:
FA $M \to$ regular expressions $R$ such that $\mathcal{L}(M) = \mathcal{L}(R)$

Non-regular languages

- The pumping lemma (if regular, can be pumped beyond a pumping length $p$)
    Corollary: if you can find an umpumpable string for all lengths, it isn't regular
- Proof by contradiction: assume regular, use properties of regular languages to arrive at a contradiction
- $L \in \mathcal{L}(a^*) \implies L^*$ is regular
